attributes.action: reverse the implementation of the Standard School Year (formerly known as the six-term year) as recommended by the Local Government Association (LGA)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
2008 will, for the first time, see the detachment of Good Friday and Easter Monday from the two-week school holiday.  

In future, the Bank Holiday weekend will only fall within the two-week break when and if it coincides with the school holiday.  

This is open discrimination towards Christians who wish to celebrate Holy Week and the days following Easter Monday with family and/or religious activities.

The implementation of this change also leads to a further erosion in Christian values and traditions, and such moves would not be permitted against other religious groups.  

The Prime Minister is urged to ensure that the Easter Holidays remain attached to the Holy and moveable feast of Easter, and that he reverses the implementation of the Standard School Year.

The Prime Minister is also asked to ensure that the term "Easter Holiday" is not replaced by "Spring Break" as currently being proposed by some local authorities within the United Kingdom.
